This app requires camera permission to use frontal camera for blink tracking
Frontal camera is not detected so tracking not available
No face detected for blinks recognition

According to National Library of Medicine report, normal blinking is essential to ensure the normal distribution of the tear film and to protect the ocular surface. Blinking abnormalities may result in poor tear distribution and hence cause damage to the ocular surface.\nSeveral studies have investigated the blink rate and the interval between blinks and it has been reported that the normal spontaneous blink rate is between 12 and 15 per minute. Other studies showed that the interval between blinks ranges from 2.8 to 4 and from 2 to 10 s. what means blink rate of up to 22 blinks per minute.
